definitions: To increase the volume, heat, or intensity of something.
To find or discover something, often unexpectedly.
To make something visible or accessible by moving or uncovering it.
To arrive or appear, especially unexpectedly or after a delay.
examples: Please turn the music up; I can barely hear it.
She turned up some interesting facts during her research.
He turned up an old photo album in the attic.
The missing keys finally turned up under the couch.
A new opportunity turned up just when I needed it.
